name: The Good Girl
description: A discount store clerk strikes up an affair with a stock boy who considers himself the incarnation of Holden Caulfield.

review.author: MrOvletine
review.heading: Love this film
review.reviewBody: It's been a while since I've seen this film. My original copy was actually on VHS, so had to wait to find a DVD. I like this movie from the start to the finish. Great characters all the way through which for me is the best part of the movie. Great acting as well. You can actually feel Justine's (Jennifer Aniston) pain at being stuck in a small town with a lousy job and the feeling that life is going nowhere. Lots of quirky turns in this film as well as the story goes along. Fun story with a lot o reality to it. I think it's one of Jennifer's best, but then I pretty much like everything she's in. Great actress.

keywords: dysfunctional marriage,small town,reference to holden caulfield,mental illness,husband wife relationship
